chunks.original_text: 谨为拜章一通，上闻三天，伏望道德曲成，慈悲善应，特降敕命，告下十方三界一切真司，原赦下民隐显之愆，垂轸岁事阻饥之苦。 亟沛甘泽，为长禾苗，更乞告宣主宰雷霆之司，掌执风雨之吏，揪涧泽洞，威圣龙神，城隍山川，祀典社貌，应千攸属，各体慈仁。 啸命风伯雨师，指麾雷公电母，普注膏雨，苏解焦枯。 臣谨为上请天翁正气君，河上真人，九海九江九河北玄君各一人，官将一百二十人，主水炁泉源，兴云致雨。 海中玉女千二百人，河伯吕公子三十六人，主兴起水脉，立降风雨。 四洲九谷君，灵台汉明君，九州玄冥君，九江北玄君，九侯君各一人，官将各一百二十人，湖中玉女千二百人，主召摄河伯使者，青水帝君，九江水帝，十二溪女，水部鬼神，河平缘吏，合符行雨。 应时下降於疆邑之内，驱雷役电，兴风布云，先霢霖於江河，次霶霈（雨＋沱）於郊野，即俾甘霖，应候好雨知时，槁禾回青，平畴变绿，苗秀而实，岁稔且禳。 腾乐事於炯原，播欢声於龄耋，愿拜成终之造，允垂资始之恩，更冀百谷用成，九垓咸遂，遗蝗遁影，妖魑潜踪。 饱食暖衣，极三农而快乐； 仰事俯育，历百岁以光华。 蒙如所陈，允昭宸贶。 祈嗣章祈嗣用 臣草芥微生，尘泥贱品，滥承正化，得奉真宗，无半功之可书，有千愆之堪录，曲蒙覆育，亶籍汪涵，敢九拜以归诚，僭一言而渎听。 臣谨据斋意，臣切惟父子有亲，人伦之本，夫妇有别，天属之常，傥身命有犯於孤辰与运限，或罹於寡宿，或相囚战，或犯刑冲，致嗣续之未谐，使宗枋之莫托，逡巡暮景，翕忽衰龄，自非请命於玄穹，曷克承恩於黄混？ 谨为拜章一通，上闻三天，伏望大德好生，至仁无外，特降敕旨，告下玄曹，应身命中，夙生今世，所有战冲，尽与解释。 仍乞赐降玉清道黑，灵宝妙光，灌注某人妻某氏身心之中，即令起处安和，胞胎凝结，疾病不作，荣卫胜常，十月周圆，诞生男嗣，愿心圆满，福庆骈臻。 臣谨为上请司命君，司录君，南斗降生度化君，束斗度星通炁君，西斗度魂结胎君，北斗通魂通血实骨君，中斗度魂成人音声君，主成就胞胎，结聚魂魄。 注生夫人，注生天女，通脉运骨天女，回星度胎天女各五人，从官各一十二人，主和合阴阳，结胎成形。 度胎夫人五人，上诣五方五斗阙下，请以五方真炁覆育己身，荣卫调和，凝结胎孕。 五行君，素白玄明君，文历君各一人，官将各一百二十人，主降炁结胎，除邪护正，解除夫妻刑害，成就阳男中神。 太和真君，阴阳生炁君，三元丹田赤白君各五人，官将各一百二十人，主血炁流通，黄白相裹，多引阳炁，牢结男胎。 阳神决吏，男神玉女各二人，甲子神人君吏，主扶助真胎凝结阳炁，若已孕女，回转为男。 即俾某人妻某氏怀胎含孕，起居不伤，全阳成男，饮食无忌，月数满足，必产阳男。 日吉时良，速得分娩，母子周圆，以为效信。 文昌祈禄章祈禄用 臣睢吁无取，骯脏何庸； 滥叨雨露之恩，惧积雷霆之谴，尚祈洪造，俯赐慈观。 臣谨据斋意，臣职惟领教理，难抑违依，按真科次第修奉。 臣切惟登崇俊良，拔擢材彦，一则阙於运限，二则系於修为，傥祖宗之积累未陈，与今昔之过愆尤厚，既乖践履，难就功名，自非帝造之维持，曷副民情之愿望？

A memorial is hereby reverently submitted to the Three Heavens, humbly beseeching the Dao’s all-accomplishing virtue and the compassionate response of boundless mercy. May a special edict be issued, commanding all true administrations across the ten directions and three realms to absolve the hidden and manifest transgressions of the common people and to relieve the hardships of a year imperiled by famine. Let sweet rains swiftly descend to nourish the young shoots. Further, may the authorities governing thunder and lightning, the officers presiding over wind and rain, the dragon deities of deep ravines and sacred springs, the city gods and mountain spirits, the altars of soil and grain, and all subordinate deities under their jurisdiction each embody merciful benevolence. Let the Lords of Wind and Rain be summoned, the Thunder Duke and Lightning Mother be directed, that timely rains may universally moisten the parched earth and revive the withered crops.

Your servant reverently petitions the Heavenly Elder of Upright Qi, the Perfected of the River’s Edge, the Nine Seas’ Nine Rivers’ Northern Mystery Lords—one each—and their retinue of one hundred twenty officials, who govern the qi of water sources and summon clouds to bring rain. From the sea, one thousand two hundred Jade Maidens; from the rivers, thirty-six Lords of the River, including Master Lü’s Heir, who command the activation of water veins and the descent of wind and rain. The Lords of the Four Continents and Nine Valleys, the Luminous Lord of the Han Terrace, the Nine Provinces’ Mysterious Darkness Lords, the Nine Rivers’ Northern Mystery Lords, and the Nine Lords of the Feudatories—one each—with their retinues of one hundred twenty officials each, and one thousand two hundred Jade Maidens of the lakes, who summon and dispatch the River Earl’s envoys, the Azure Water Thearch, the Nine Rivers’ Water Thearchs, the Twelve Stream Maidens, the water-department spirits and river-pacifying officers, to act in concert and bring rain. May they descend in timely fashion upon the realm’s borders, driving thunder and dispatching lightning, stirring winds and spreading clouds. First, let gentle rains fall upon the rivers; next, let torrents pour across the fields and wilds. May sweet rains promptly answer the season’s call, reviving withered grain and turning barren plains to green. May the shoots flower and bear fruit, the year yield abundance, and calamities be averted. Let joy resound across the plains, and gladness echo among the aged. May the petitioner’s lifelong devotion be fulfilled, and the grace of foundational blessings be generously bestowed. Further, may all grains ripen, the nine regions prosper, locusts vanish without trace, and malevolent spirits retreat into hiding. Let the three agricultural seasons bring full bellies and warm clothing, and may all people, in serving their elders and nurturing their young, live a hundred years in radiant splendor. Should this plea be granted, the imperial favor shall shine forth in full.

A second memorial is reverently submitted to the Three Heavens, beseeching continued grace. Your servant, a lowly speck of dust, unworthy and base, has presumptuously received the true teachings yet possesses no merit worthy of record, only countless faults deserving of censure. Yet, through the boundless grace of nurturing protection, I dare to prostrate nine times in utmost sincerity and offer these humble words, trusting they may reach the celestial hearing.

Your servant, in accordance with the fast’s intent, reflects that the bond between father and child is the foundation of human relations, and the proper distinction between husband and wife is the constant of heavenly affinity. If one’s fate is afflicted by solitary stars or adverse conjunctions—whether by encountering the Widow Star, mutual imprisonment, or clashes with penal stars—so that the line of descent remains unfulfilled and the ancestral lineage finds no heir, then as twilight approaches and the years hasten toward decline, without petitioning the Dark Vault of Heaven, how can one hope to receive the grace of the Yellow Prime?

A memorial is hereby reverently submitted to the Three Heavens, humbly beseeching the great virtue of cherishing life and the perfect benevolence that excludes none. May a special edict be issued, commanding the Dark Bureau to absolve all conflicts and clashes in the petitioner’s present and past lives. Further, may the Jade Purity’s Daoist Blackness and the Numinous Treasure’s Wondrous Radiance be bestowed, pouring into the body and mind of the petitioner’s wife, Mistress So-and-so, that she may rise and move in peace, her womb quicken with conception, illness be averted, and her vital and protective qi flourish beyond the ordinary. May the ten months pass in fullness, and a male heir be born, fulfilling the petitioner’s deepest wish and bringing manifold blessings.

Your servant reverently petitions the Lords of Life and Record, the Southern Dipper’s Lord of Birth and Transformation, the Eastern Dipper’s Lord of Stellar Qi Communication, the Western Dipper’s Lord of Soul Formation and Fetal Conception, the Northern Dipper’s Lord of Soul Communication and Blood-Bone Solidification, and the Central Dipper’s Lord of Soul Transformation and Vocal Articulation—each charged with perfecting the womb and gathering the hun and po souls. The Lady of Birth, the Heavenly Maidens of Birth, the Heavenly Maidens of Meridian and Bone Circulation, and the Heavenly Maidens of Stellar Fetal Transformation—five each—with their retinues of twelve officials each, who harmonize yin and yang and shape the fetus. Five Ladies of Fetal Transformation, who ascend to the palaces of the Five Directions and Five Dippers, beseeching the true qi of the five directions to nurture the petitioner’s wife, Mistress So-and-so, regulating her vital and protective qi to solidify the pregnancy. The Lords of the Five Phases, the White Mystery Lord of Primordial Clarity, and the Literary Chronicle Lord—one each—with their retinues of one hundred twenty officials each, who descend qi to form the fetus, expel evil and protect the upright, resolve marital clashes, and ensure the birth of a male child. The Lords of Supreme Harmony, the Lords of Yin-Yang Generative Qi, and the Lords of the Three Primes’ Cinnabar Fields—five each—with their retinues of one hundred twenty officials each, who circulate blood and qi, envelop the white with the yellow, and draw abundant yang qi to firmly bind the male fetus. The Yang Spirit Envoys, the Male Spirit and Jade Maidens—two each—and the Lords of the First Celestial Stem, who assist in solidifying the true fetus and gathering yang qi, transforming a female fetus into a male if conception has already occurred. May the petitioner’s wife, Mistress So-and-so, conceive and carry the child without harm, bearing a male of pure yang, free from dietary restrictions. May the months of pregnancy be fulfilled, and a male child be born without delay at an auspicious day and hour. May mother and child emerge whole, serving as a sign of efficacy.

A third memorial is reverently submitted, beseeching official emolument. Your servant, worthless and filthy, has presumptuously received the grace of rain and dew, yet fears the accumulation of thunderous reproach. I humbly implore the vast creation to deign to regard me with compassion.

Your servant, charged with transmitting the teachings, finds it difficult to refuse the faithful yet follows the true statutes in sequential practice. I reflect that the promotion of the worthy and the elevation of the talented depend first on fate’s conjunctions and second on personal cultivation. If the accumulated merits of ancestors remain unpresented, and past and present transgressions are particularly grave, then even with diligent practice, official rank will prove elusive. Without the Thearch’s sustaining grace, how can the people’s hopes be fulfilled?

chunks.original_text: 谨为拜章一通，上闻三天，伏望大慈曲垂惠泽，特降敕命，行下三界合属玄曹，为某人禳谢星缠，和平运气，赦除障累，纪录善功，增注勋名，光荣宗祖。 臣谨为上请夫子君一人，官将一百二十人，东井清明君央了吏，一合来下，以温润清和英灵善爽之黑，下布某人五藏四肢，身体骨节之间，安定神灵，卫护真炁，驱三尸，灭九虫，背死向生，却祸来福，心志开通，超拔林能。 五经九炁君一人，官将一百二十人，主智慧圆明，与众有异，天王玉女千二百人，衣青衣，主部领万官赐以印绶，运为举动，能通神明。 玉历素女千二百人，衣赤衣，主纪姓名於玉历，注寿算於丹书。 若某人入仕之初，或愿主仓库，或愿职金帛，或愿典场务，或愿领兵卒，或愿司学校者，则阴阳有神灵主之，乞为关告所在灵应神祇、正直土地，默赐骘相，使之爵禄随心，德行备足。 若大选之后，图谋愿望，升品进阶者，则上有星辰主之，乞为宣告紫微太微二垣，公卿将相，大理尚书，文昌三台，南斗北斗，东璧奎宿，羽林垒壁，师门将军，应主宰人间官职。 诸星并为垂象，宣精舒光绚彩，即俾横飞，直上於省台部监，徼塞边陲，有九迁之荣华，膺十赉之富贵，公忠许国，清白传家，禄寿兼全，以为效信。 延生解厄延毒章祈寿用 臣夙藉庆基，生逢昌运，佩鸾图而领教，承凤牒以学真，亶赖帡幪，若为报称，辄渍千钧之听，庸陈一得之愚，仰冀高明，俯垂监察。 臣谨据斋意，臣切惟人情欲寿，大德好生，傥运限有犯於威踱，致身命或临於屯否，易逢厄疾，曷保年龄？ 今某人藉祖宗积累之功，膺门户付托之任，欲祈眉寿，或衍遐龄，庸安乐於期顺，勿驰驱於障难，子孙昌炽，富贵利宜，自非玄造之慈观、焉得黄垓之佚老？ 谨为拜章一通，上闻三天，伏望广运深仁，廓施惠泽，特降敕命，行下三界十方合属玄曹，为某人辟斥凶星，断除戾炁，冤愆顿释，身心双隆，八节四时，纤灾无惹，常居吉庆，永处福龄，百岁周圆，一身康泰。 臣谨为上请天曹，解厄去祸君，益算延寿君，五方生炁君，六甲将军，主消灾度厄，益命除邪。 太和真一好生君，万福君，解刑度厄君，益寿延命君，请命好生君，保命生黑君，收刑却煞君，斩绝刑煞，增益寿命。 万福君，运炁君，解厄君，南上君，司命君，司录君，太白明星君，拘魂拘魄君，财库君，禄库君，定名玉历君各五人，官将各一百二十人，主落除死籍，注上生名。 收姅君，断祥君，破（歹＋羊）君各一人，官将各一百二十人，主解除（歹＋羊）厄，拔赎寿命。 东斗主算君，西斗纪名君，北斗落死君，南斗上生君，中斗大魁君各一人，官将一百二十人，主度脱五行灾厄，增纪寿算。 六十甲子，从官吏兵，主张解年穷算尽之厄，消除命衰运败之灾。 五方五帝君，从官吏兵，各乘本方真炁，执符持节，上诣二十三天星宿，玉历之宫，检寻命籍，增注年龄。 延命大将军，兵士千二百人，主解消灾厄，增益年命。 明堂君，南昌君，朱陵君，黄老君，天魂地魄君各一人，拔命君十二人，鼎仓玉女五人，五纬玉女，起生玉女，玉历玉女各一千二百人，主度脱年命，增寿延生。 诸部官君，和合保护，解除二十四厄，增延寿算。

A solemn memorial is hereby reverently presented, ascending to the Three Heavens. May the Great Compassion deign to bestow its gracious favor, issuing a special imperial decree to be transmitted throughout the Three Realms and all subordinate offices of the Mysterious Bureaus. For [the petitioner’s name], may it dispel stellar entanglements, harmonize the flow of qi, absolve accumulated hindrances, record meritorious deeds, and augment official rank, thereby glorifying the ancestral lineage.

Your servant humbly petitions the Master Lord, one person, and the divine generals, one hundred twenty in number, along with the Clear Brightness Lord of the Eastern Well and his attending officers, to descend as one. With the warming, moistening, clear, harmonious, numinous, and beneficent black [essence], may they suffuse [the petitioner’s] five viscera, four limbs, body, and joints, settling the spirit, safeguarding the true qi, expelling the Three Corpses, eradicating the Nine Worms, turning from death toward life, averting misfortune and summoning blessings, opening the mind and elevating talents.

The Lord of the Five Classics and Nine Qi, one person, with his one hundred twenty generals, presides over perfect wisdom and luminous clarity, distinct from the multitude. The Heavenly Kings and Jade Maidens, one thousand two hundred in number, clad in azure robes, lead the myriad officials, bestowing seals and cords to govern all movements and enable communion with the divine.

The Jade Calendar Maidens of the White Register, one thousand two hundred in number, clad in crimson robes, record names in the Jade Calendar and inscribe longevity in the Vermilion Register.

Should [the petitioner], at the outset of an official career, aspire to oversee granaries, manage treasuries, supervise markets, command troops, or administer schools, then let the deities of yin and yang preside over these domains. May the responsive and upright local spirits be entreated to secretly bestow their favor, ensuring that rank and emolument align with his aspirations and that virtue and conduct attain perfection.

After the great selection, should he seek advancement in rank and promotion in office, then let the stellar bodies above govern his fate. May the Purple Tenuity and Supreme Tenuity enclosures, the ducal ministers and generals, the Minister of Justice, the Chief Ministers, the Three Terraces of Wenchang, the Southern and Northern Dippers, the Eastern Wall and Straddler constellations, the Feathered Forest and Rampart Walls, and the Generals of the Strategic Gates—all who preside over human offices—be entreated. Let these stars collectively manifest their portents, radiating their essence and unfurling their luminous splendor, enabling him to soar directly into the ministries, departments, and frontier commands. May he attain the glory of ninefold advancement, the wealth of tenfold bounty, serve the state with loyalty, transmit purity to his descendants, and enjoy the fullness of emolument and longevity as a sign of efficacy.

---

**Memorial for Prolonging Life and Dispelling Calamity, Invoking Longevity**

Your servant, born under auspicious foundations and flourishing fortune, has worn the Chart of the Phoenix to transmit the teachings and received the Script of the Phoenix to study the true. Profoundly reliant on celestial shelter, how may I repay such grace? I dare to pour forth my humble thoughts before the thousand-weight hearing of the august, humbly beseeching the exalted to deign to observe and examine.

Your servant, in accordance with the intent of the fast, reflects that while human nature desires longevity, the great virtue cherishes life. If one’s fate encounters the tread of ominous stars, or one’s person faces adversity, how can calamitous illness be avoided, and how may years be preserved?

Now [the petitioner], inheriting the accumulated merits of his ancestors and bearing the responsibility of his household’s trust, seeks to prolong his years or extend his lifespan, to enjoy peace in due time and avoid toil amid obstacles, that his descendants may flourish and his prosperity and advantage abound. Without the compassionate regard of the Mysterious Creation, how may he attain the carefree old age of the Yellow Springs?

A solemn memorial is hereby reverently presented, ascending to the Three Heavens. May the vast workings of profound benevolence broadly bestow gracious favor, issuing a special imperial decree to be transmitted throughout the Three Realms, the Ten Directions, and all subordinate offices of the Mysterious Bureaus. For [the petitioner], may it repel inauspicious stars, sever malevolent qi, instantly release grievances, and elevate both body and mind. Through the eight solar terms and four seasons, may no trifling misfortune be incurred, and may he ever dwell in felicity, forever abiding in blessed longevity, completing a full century in peace and health.

Your servant humbly petitions the Heavenly Bureaus: the Lord Who Dispels Calamity and Removes Misfortune, the Lord Who Augments Longevity, the Lords of the Five Directions’ Generative Qi, and the Generals of the Six Jia, who preside over the elimination of disasters and the deliverance from calamity, the augmentation of life and the expulsion of evil.

The True Unity Lord of Great Harmony Who Cherishes Life, the Lord of Myriad Blessings, the Lord Who Dispels Punishments and Delivers from Calamity, the Lord Who Augments Lifespan and Prolongs Life, the Lord Who Invokes Life and Cherishes Existence, the Lord Who Preserves Life and Generates Black [Essence], the Lord Who Withdraws Punishments and Repels Destruction, who severs and extinguishes punitive forces, augmenting lifespan.

The Lord of Myriad Blessings, the Lord Who Circulates Qi, the Lord Who Dispels Calamity, the Southern Superior Lord, the Lord of Life Mandate, the Lord of Life Records, the Bright Star Lord of Venus, the Lords Who Restrain Hun and Po Souls, the Lord of the Treasury of Wealth, the Lord of the Treasury of Emolument, and the Lord Who Fixes Names in the Jade Calendar, each five in number, with one hundred twenty generals each, who preside over the removal of names from the Register of Death and the inscription of names in the Register of Life.

The Lords Who Gather Grievances, Sever Omens, and Break Calamities, each one person, with one hundred twenty generals each, who preside over the resolution of calamities and the redemption of lifespan.

The Lord of Longevity in the Eastern Dipper, the Lord of Name-Recording in the Western Dipper, the Lord of Death-Removal in the Northern Dipper, the Lord of Life-Inscription in the Southern Dipper, and the Great Chief Lord of the Central Dipper, each one person, with one hundred twenty generals each, who preside over the deliverance from the five phases’ disasters and the augmentation of lifespan records.

The sixty cyclical signs, with their attending officials and soldiers, who preside over the resolution of the calamity of exhausted years and the elimination of disasters from declining fate and failing fortune.

The Lords of the Five Directions and Five Thearchs, with their attending officials and soldiers, each riding the true qi of their respective directions, wielding talismans and holding staffs, ascending to the palaces of the twenty-three celestial lodges and the Jade Calendar, to inspect the Registers of Life and augment the years inscribed.

The Great General Who Prolongs Life, with one thousand two hundred soldiers, who presides over the resolution of disasters and the augmentation of lifespan.

The Lords of the Hall of Light, Southern Prosperity, Vermilion Mound, Yellow Elder, Heavenly Hun and Earthly Po, each one person; the Twelve Lords Who Deliver Life; the Five Jade Maidens of the Tripod Granary; the Jade Maidens of the Five Planets; the Jade Maidens Who Raise Life; and the Jade Maidens of the Jade Calendar, one thousand two hundred each, who preside over the deliverance from the calamities of years and the augmentation of lifespan.

All the departmental lords and officials, harmonizing and protecting, resolving the twenty-four calamities and augmenting longevity.

chunks.original_text: 即俾某人命运亨通，灾危驱遁，福禄兴萃，寿算延长，无难无灾，多祥多庆，云仍衮衮，门户辉辉，以为效信。 谢罪祈晴章祈晴用 臣禀资疏散，赋性庸愚，印武班联，强颜奏对，每扪心而省过，期弘道以宪天，庶证勋劳，上裨化育。 臣谨据斋意，臣切惟务农种谷，亶藉天时，秋敛春耕，惟资地利，所愿五风而十雨，庶令百谷以三登。 况兹郊野之田，势处陂塘之侧，才致霪撩，澎湃莫支，乃经旬罹积雨之伤，致稻苗多乘流而槁。 岁事足虑，生民荐饥，若非开霁以断流，何以有年而多稼？ 全资圣造，特赐慈观。 谨为拜章一通，上闻三天，伏望帝德好生，民情堪悯，特降敕命，关告匝境里社，一切玄司，散兹雨阴，即成晴淋，庶得三农勤动，百谷丰成，田畴无滨浸之忧，黎庶免饥馑之苦，优游卒岁，允藉天恩。 臣谨为上请天爷正炁君一人，官将一百二十人，兵士七十万人，九海北玄君一人，官将一百二十人，河上玉女千二百人，主收云止雨，致风兴霁。 水泉官属八海九江缘吏，主决开壅脉，疏导百川，即俾四境狂霖，登时开霁，阴云解驳，红日陆离，田野欢心，耕耘乐意。 坐看刈获，白粲登场，实叨覆护之恩，加拜生成之赐。 更祈敕旨，行下四海四渎，溪源潭洞，应干龙神，泊玄虚主，掌今年今季风雷雨部，一切神祇，咸令知委，并与停风息浪，收雨散云，浓阴开明，日光照野，禾稻丰稔，稼穑盈成，乐岁无忧，以为效信。 禳火灾章禳灾道场用 臣草茅贱质，棂砾散材，谬处班联，滥司济度，敢罄小心之梼，庸祈大造之仁。 臣谨据斋意，臣切惟仰事俯育，端藉室庐，接楝连甍，乃堪衣食，实生成之厚利，宜上帝之矜怜。 倏於前朝忽传星变，谓来堕於屋角，势有似於火殃，由中惊惶，罔知攸措。 私料近至信宿，远则旬时，恐有燎原之忧，或致焚如之惨，绵连井落，延亘乡闻。 若非请命於上苍， 曷克流恩於下界？

May it be thus granted that so-and-so’s fate flows smoothly, disasters and dangers are driven far away, blessings and emoluments flourish and gather, lifespan is prolonged, no difficulties nor calamities arise, and manifold auspiciousness and felicity abound. May descendants multiply in unbroken succession, and gates and households shine with radiance, as proof of efficacy.

**Memorial of Gratitude for Expiation and Prayer for Clear Skies**

Your servant, of humble and scattered endowment, by nature dull and foolish, yet ranked among the military and civil officials, forces himself to present memorials and respond in audience. Ever examining his heart to reflect on faults, he aspires to propagate the Dao and emulate Heaven, hoping thereby to attest to meritorious service and assist in the transformation and nurturance of all beings.

Your servant, in accordance with the intent of the fast, humbly considers that the cultivation of crops and sowing of grain depend entirely upon Heaven’s timing, while autumn harvests and spring plowing rely solely on Earth’s bounty. It is wished that five winds and ten rains be bestowed, that the hundred grains may achieve triple abundance.

Moreover, the fields of the outskirts and countryside lie adjacent to ponds and embankments. When excessive rains arise, their surging becomes uncontrollable. Having endured ten days of continuous rain, the rice seedlings have largely been swept away by the currents and withered. The prospects for the year give cause for concern, and the people face impending famine. If the skies do not clear to stem the floods, how can there be a year of abundant harvest?

Relying entirely upon the sagely creation, I humbly beseech Your merciful regard. I reverently present this memorial to ascend to the Three Heavens, trusting that the Emperor’s virtue, which cherishes life, and his compassion for the people’s plight, will prompt the issuance of a special edict. May it be proclaimed to the local altars and all the mysterious bureaus within the realm, dispersing the rain and gloom, swiftly bringing forth clear skies. Thus may the three agricultural labors proceed with diligence, the hundred grains ripen in abundance, the fields be free from the woes of inundation, and the common people be spared the suffering of hunger and famine. May they pass the year in ease, truly indebted to Heaven’s grace.

Your servant reverently petitions for the presence of the Lord of the True Qi of Heaven, one person, with one hundred twenty officials and generals, and seven hundred thousand soldiers; the Lord of the Northern Mystery of the Nine Seas, one person, with one hundred twenty officials and generals; and the Jade Maidens of the River, one thousand two hundred persons, who preside over the gathering of clouds and cessation of rain, the summoning of winds and the clearing of skies. May the officials and subordinates of the Water Springs, the functionaries of the Eight Seas and Nine Rivers, who govern the unblocking of obstructed channels and the dredging of the hundred streams, promptly dispel the relentless rains across the four borders, dissolving the dark clouds and revealing the radiant sun. May the fields and countryside rejoice in gladness, and the toil of plowing and sowing proceed with joy. May we soon witness the harvest, the white grain piled upon the threshing grounds, truly basking in the grace of protection and the bounty of life’s sustenance.

Furthermore, I pray that an edict be issued to the Four Seas and Four Rivers, the streams, springs, pools, and caverns, and all the dragon spirits and mysterious lords concerned, who oversee the departments of wind, thunder, and rain for this year and season. May all the deities be duly informed and commanded to still the winds, calm the waves, gather the rain, disperse the clouds, lift the dense gloom, and allow the sunlight to illuminate the fields. May the rice and grain be abundant, the crops and harvests reach fullness, and the year pass without care, as proof of efficacy.

**Memorial for the Averting of Fire Disasters**

Your servant, a humble and worthless being of rustic origins, a scattered pebble among timber, presumptuously occupies a place among the ranks of officials and is entrusted with the task of salvation. Daring to pour forth the prayers of a humble heart, I humbly beseech the great benevolence of creation.

Your servant, in accordance with the intent of the fast, humbly considers that in serving those above and nurturing those below, we depend entirely upon our dwellings. With eaves adjoining and roofs connected, they suffice for clothing and sustenance, truly a profound benefit of life’s creation, worthy of the Supreme Emperor’s compassion.

Suddenly, in the previous court assembly, word came of a celestial anomaly, said to have fallen near the corner of a house, resembling the portent of a fire calamity. The people were seized with alarm, not knowing what to do. I privately reckon that, whether in the near term of a day or two or the longer span of ten days, there is fear of a conflagration spreading like wildfire, or the devastation of a raging inferno, extending across neighborhoods and villages. If we do not petition the Supreme Heaven for aid, how can grace flow down to the lower realms?

chunks.original_text: 谨为拜章一通，上闻三天，伏望广运隆慈，廓施妙化，特降敕命，关告匝境里域，一切真司，为某人驱除火灾，即移他境，无生殃咎，流虐黎元。 臣谨为上请九海北玄君，天翁正炁君，兵星神君，游都君，明星君，诛殃君，天昌君各一人，官将各一百二十人，河上玉女千二百人，盖天大将军黄衣兵吏各十万人，无上天君兵士七十万人，主动毕星升阴炁，驱六丁六甲，消灭火殃之鬼，驱逐火精之怪，与北方黑帝羽子之精，壬癸正炁，太阴水德，防制火灾，即令断绝。 仍关风伯雨师下雨灭火，当境神祇，斥遣火怪，速令远离，庶得流荧迁徙，里社安宁，眷序不移，屋宅如故，以昭宸既。 谢罪遗蝗保田章禳蝗道场用 臣尘泥贱品，草莽微生，值昌运之兴行，际真诠之晓觉，学真领教，弘道度人，誓补过以立功，庸承流而宣化。 臣谨据斋意，臣切惟春耕秋敛，觊尔有年，地疠天灾，将成凶岁。 既虫蝗之诞发，实妖戾之肆兴，林木尽童，田禾俱食，非笺心而哀吁，为请命以祈禳，曷保稻粱，终无损蠹。 谨为拜章一通，上闻三天，伏望广运慈悲，曲加鉴采，特降敕命，关告匝境，一切神司，辟斥妖蝗，断除戾炁，乘狂风而徙他境，因暴雨而移别乡，悉化余虫，无令遗种，庶得田禾秀发，成熟可期。 臣谨为上请四野君，五野君，九野君，里域山川社稷君，蕴元君，白蚕五谷君，大田五斗君，六富君各二人，官将各百二十人，地畜君，天甲君，五千王君各一十二人，官将各一百二十人，主田畴丰稔，五谷登成，辟斥螟蝗，驱除鼠雀，稻苗秀好，虫域遁逃。 与社稷山川城隍神君，递相保护，即俾田禾秀实，虫蝗去离，转之外疆，以为效信。 诸章官式祈禳通用 保蚕 谨为上请暴食君，供食君，千泽君各一人，官将各一百二十人，仙宫玄男玄女，神男神女，素男素女，玉男玉女，蚕室仙吏，丝绵仙吏二十四人，养育蚕桑，保护丝茧，辟斥鼠耗，万倍称收。 保胎 谨为上请安胎君，护胎君，扶衰度厄君，万福解厄君，护胎圣母，天医玉女，护胎成生吏，保胎成生圣母，各二人，主保护胎孕，无有疾伤，十月周圆，产暮快利。 天医太产吏，治通乳母，天门中君，天医助生君，催生童子各二人，官将各一百二十人，主调理阴阳，和安胎藏，产募无阻，得就阳男。 九天好生君，监生大神，卫房圣母，主录勒籍真君，传胎应梦童子，三元保胎大神，六十甲子从官符吏，主保胎护命，定魄安魂，临产之时，毋有厄难。 保男 谨为上请阳仙护魂君，阴仙护魄君，天灵阳生君，主通於营卫，乳食平安。 太皇万福君，解患君各五人，官将各一百二十人，主录护生气，辟斥邪精。 逐盗 谨为上请五阳君，斥灾君，营星君各一人，天位君，暴胜君，东西太白君各五人，官将各一百二十人，摇天动地君，九炁太兵五十万人，赤衣日男、白衣月女各千二百人，绛衣日月大兵，承天大将军兵士各十万人，追逐寇盗，驱斥贼徒，远离门庭，惠安闲里。 保六畜 谨为上请六畜王相君，天阳君，天仪君，天休君，黑水期君各一人，官将各一百二十人，主孳养六畜，荣盛不伤，断逐疫瘟，斥除邪炁。 岁星太元君一人，官将一百二十人，周天兵士十万人，主治祠庙伤鬼擅杀六畜。

I humbly present this memorial, offering it to the Three Heavens, and prostrate myself in hope that Your vast and majestic compassion may extend its wondrous transformation. May You issue a special decree, commanding all divine administrators within the boundless precincts and villages to drive away the fire calamity threatening this person, banishing it to distant lands, that no misfortune or harm may befall the suffering common folk.

I reverently invoke the Nine Seas’ Northern Dark Lord, the Heavenly Elder of Upright Qi, the Star of War, the Wandering Capital, the Radiant Star, the Punisher of Calamities, and the Heavenly Prosperity Lord—each one—along with their 120 officials and generals; the River’s Jade Maidens, 1,200 in number; the Yellow-Robed Soldiers of the Great Heaven-Covering General, 100,000 strong; and the 700,000 troops of the Supreme Heavenly Lord. May they mobilize the ascending yin qi of the Net Star, dispatch the Six Ding and Six Jia spirits, annihilate the demons of fire calamity, and expel the specters of fire essence. Together with the essence of the Black Emperor’s Feathered Son of the North, the true qi of Ren and Gui, and the water virtue of Grand Yin, may they restrain and extinguish the fire disaster, severing it utterly.

Furthermore, may the Wind Earl and Rain Master be commanded to descend and quench the flames with rain, while the local deities drive away the fire spirits, swiftly banishing them to distant realms. Thus may the wandering embers be removed, the villages and communities restored to peace, households remain undisturbed, and dwellings stand as before, all to manifest the imperial grace.

---

**Memorial for Offering Thanks and Dispelling Locusts to Protect the Fields**

I, a lowly being of dust and grass, born in this flourishing era of true teaching, have studied the Dao and received its instruction, vowing to propagate the Way and deliver humanity. I pledge to atone for faults through meritorious deeds, upholding the current and spreading transformation.

I humbly submit this memorial, reflecting the intent of the ritual, for I deeply consider that spring plowing and autumn harvests promise a year of abundance, yet earthly blight and heavenly disasters threaten to bring a year of famine. Now that locusts have erupted in swarms, and malevolent forces run rampant, devouring forests and fields alike, if I do not pour out my heart in lament and petition for divine intervention, how can the crops be safeguarded from ruin?

I humbly present this memorial, offering it to the Three Heavens, and prostrate myself in hope that Your boundless compassion may deign to heed my plea. May You issue a special decree, commanding all divine administrators within the boundless precincts to repel the locust plague, sever the malevolent qi, and carry them away on fierce winds to distant lands or sweep them off with torrential rains to other regions. May every last insect be transformed, leaving no trace, so that the fields may flourish, and a bountiful harvest be assured.

I reverently invoke the Lords of the Four Wilds, the Five Wilds, and the Nine Wilds; the Lords of Villages, Mountains, Rivers, and Altars of Soil and Grain; the Mistress of Vital Essence; the White Silkworm and Five Grains Lord; the Great Fields and Five Measures Lord; and the Six Abundance Lords—each two in number—along with their 120 officials and generals. I also invoke the Lords of Earthly Livestock, Heavenly Armor, and the Five Thousand Kings—each twelve in number—with their 120 officials and generals. May they ensure the fertility of the fields, the ripening of the Five Grains, repel locusts and crickets, and drive away rats and sparrows, so that the rice seedlings flourish and the pests flee in terror.

Together with the Lords of Altars of Soil and Grain, Mountains, Rivers, and City Walls, may they mutually safeguard the land, ensuring the crops bear fruit while the locusts depart, banished to foreign borders as a sign of efficacy.

---

**General Memorial Forms for Petition and Exorcism**

**For Silkworm Protection**
I reverently invoke the Lords of Voracious Appetite, Provision, and Thousand Marshes—each one—along with their 120 officials and generals; the Immortal Boys and Girls of the Mystic Palace, Divine Boys and Girls, Plain Boys and Girls, Jade Boys and Girls; and the 24 Silk and Cotton Immortal Officers. May they nurture the silkworms and mulberry trees, protect the cocoons and silk, and repel rats and vermin, ensuring a hundredfold yield.

**For Fetal Protection**
I reverently invoke the Lords of Placental Peace, Placental Guardianship, Support in Decline and Deliverance from Calamity, and Myriad Blessings and Calamity Dispeller—each two in number; the Holy Mother of Placental Protection, the Jade Maidens of Heavenly Medicine, the Officers of Placental Preservation and Birth, and the Holy Mother of Placental and Birth Preservation. May they safeguard the fetus, preventing illness or harm, ensuring a full ten-month term and a swift, smooth delivery.

I also invoke the Heavenly Physicians and Great Birth Officers, the Nurturing Wet-Nurses, the Lords of the Heavenly Gate’s Center, the Heavenly Physicians Aiding Birth, and the Hastening Birth Boys—each two in number—with their 120 officials and generals. May they regulate yin and yang, harmonize the fetal organs, and ensure an unobstructed birth, resulting in a healthy male child.

I further invoke the Nine Heavens’ Lord of Life-Giving, the Great Supervisors of Birth, the Holy Mother of the Womb Chamber, the True Lords of Birth Records, the Dream-Interpreting Boys of Fetal Transmission, the Three Origins’ Great Gods of Placental Protection, and the 60 Jiazi Attendant Talisman Officers. May they protect the fetus and preserve life, stabilize the po and calm the hun, ensuring no calamity befalls the mother at the time of delivery.

**For Male Child Protection**
I reverently invoke the Yang Immortals’ Lord of Soul Protection, the Yin Immortals’ Lord of Po Protection, and the Heavenly Numinous Lord of Yang Birth. May they ensure the harmony of the constructive and defensive qi, and the child’s peaceful nourishment.

I also invoke the Supreme August Lord of Myriad Blessings and the Dispeller of Afflictions—each five in number—with their 120 officials and generals. May they record and protect the vital qi, repelling evil spirits.

**For Bandit Expulsion**
I reverently invoke the Lords of the Five Yang, Disaster Repulsion, and Encampment Star—each one; the Lords of Heavenly Position, Sudden Victory, and the Eastern and Western Venus—each five in number—with their 120 officials and generals. I also invoke the Lord Who Shakes Heaven and Earth, the 500,000 Great Soldiers of the Nine Qi, the 1,200 Red-Robed Sun Boys and White-Robed Moon Girls, the Crimson-Robed Great Soldiers of the Sun and Moon, and the 100,000 troops of the Heaven-Bearing Great General. May they pursue and expel bandits and thieves, driving them far from homes and villages, bringing peace and tranquility to the people.

**For Livestock Protection**
I reverently invoke the Lords of the Six Livestock’s Prosperity, Heavenly Yang, Heavenly Propriety, Heavenly Fortune, and Black Water’s Term—each one—with their 120 officials and generals. May they ensure the flourishing and unharmed growth of the six livestock, dispelling epidemics and repelling malevolent qi.

I also invoke the Supreme Origin Lord of the Year Star, with 120 officials and generals, and 100,000 troops encircling the heavens. May they govern the shrine demons that harm and slaughter livestock.

chunks.original_text: 章 破酆都开业道章关度黄镰用 具位臣某诚惶诚恐，稽首顿首，再拜上言，臣棂砾散材，蓬茅贱质，幸绿宿庆，滥缀真班，功无丝粟之圆，过有渊陵之积，曲蒙涵贷、未赐诛夷，誓勉操修，庸期报称，既承投恳，敢不关闻。 臣谨据入意，臣切惟三官九署，北都罗酆，六洞十宫，冥关幽夜，水火考对，生死拘维，茹苦终天，千龄展转，虽众生之妄业自受，而上玄之仁泽堪矜，非赖赦原，曷臻超迈？ 谨为拜章一通，上闻三天，伏望慈悲，曲垂矜悯，特降玉清道炁，灵宝妙光，焕朗十方，开明九垒，即俾亡故，某人暨九玄七祖，亿劫种亲，六道四生，诸类幽爽，灌沐妙炁，顿悟良心，宿劫冤愆，应时解散。 臣谨为上请十方飞天使者，十方救苦玉童玉女，上诣三天金阙玉陛下，请降元始符命，救苦真符，告下十方三界无极神乡天地水官，阴阳罪录。 三官九府，百二十曹，北都罗酆，内外宫洞，阿鼻无间，大小铁围，十二河源，泉曲之府，九幽五岳，罪考主司，五苦三涂，诸大地狱，五道都府，执法冥曹，乘此符光，辉明照、耀，铁城摧毁，苦考蠲停，枷索脱除，系囚消废，炉炭铜柱，化作骞林，擭汤冰池，悉成莲沼，灰河炮炭，俱变清冻，剑戟刀山，尽为宝树，镯炎炎烈火之狱，烁重重金刚之山，执对停平，冤仇和释，恶根落灭，罪籍捐除，赦宥亡过。 某人溥及幽冥，无鞅滞爽囚徒苦趣，悉遂逍遥，滞魄沉魂，各获解脱，更希睿旨，勑下青官，开紫阳玉匮之函，出应化慈尊之号，十方流演，万品皈依，广开法门，飞度累户，庶使善绿雾霖，灵既罗敷，均沐生成，以为效信，恩惟太上，分别求哀。 臣愚谨因二官直使，正一功曹，左右官使者，阴阳神诀吏，科车赤符吏，刚风骑置吏，驿马上章吏，飞龙骑吏，进章凤凰骑，上章云龙骑，言章风发骑，御章神龙骑，奏章飞龙飞虎骑各二人出操。 臣为斋主某拜上破酆都开业道章文，上诣三天曹，伏愿天恩告报。 臣诚惶诚恐，稽首顿首，再拜以闻。 空三行 臣姓某属州某县某乡某里某宫观某靖焚修。 空三行 太上无形无名虚无自然至真大道无上玄尊金阙七宝玉陛下。 空三行 太岁某年月日於某处拜上。 右凡书章用黄纸朱书，纸高一尺一寸六分，行阔一寸二分，幅宜单幅，幅宜单行，每行定排十七字，前一幅背两行，空第三行，方写章街迭书，下写臣某诚惶诚恐，稽首顿首再拜。 此一行不背字，看长短到何处住。 第四行写上言字，低於职街一寸，此行方背十七字数也。 自上言以下，至后每行捎字如法，行上留半存，行下不通。 走螳人姓名作一字，写不得抽破，如鬼字，如凶字，如死字，如贼字，诸不佳字不得在行上头。 如仙字、人字、生字诸佳字不得在行下头写，至以为效信。 即揍云：恩惟太上，分别求哀，臣愚馑因二官直使，正一功曹，左右官使者，阴阳神诀史，科车赤符史，刚风骑置吏，驿马上章史，飞龙骑吏，进章凤凰骑，上章云龙骑，言章风发骑，御章神龙骑，奏章飞龙飞虎骑各二人出操。 臣为斋主某人拜上某章，上诣三天曹，伏愿天恩告报。 臣诚惶诚恐，稽首顿首，再拜以闻。 以闻二字低前行一字，与再拜相去空三行，迭书臣姓某，属州某县某乡某里某官观某靖焚修，须自半行写至下，其下与纸下头相平。

**Petition to Break Open Fengdu and Unseal the Dao of Merit for the Yellow Register**

Your humble servant, [Name], of lowly rank, prostrates himself in awe and reverence, bowing his head to the ground in repeated obeisance, and respectfully submits this petition. This worthless one, a mere speck of dust and blade of grass, has undeservedly received the blessings of past virtue, fraudulently occupying a place among the ranks of the Perfected. My merits are as meager as a grain of millet, while my transgressions are as vast as the deepest abyss. Yet, by the grace of your boundless forbearance, I have not been condemned to destruction. I vow to redouble my efforts in cultivation, striving to repay even a fraction of this debt. Having received this earnest plea, how dare I not bring it to your attention?

Your servant, in accordance with the petitioner’s intent, humbly reflects: The Three Bureaus and Nine Offices, the Northern Capital of Fengdu, the Six Caverns and Ten Palaces, the dark gates of the netherworld, the trials of water and fire, the bonds of life and death—all these constrain souls to endure eternal suffering, rolling through a thousand ages. Though such is the karmic retribution of sentient beings for their deluded deeds, the compassion of the Supreme Mystery is still moved to pity. Without the grace of amnesty, how could they attain liberation?

Thus, I reverently present this petition to the Three Heavens, beseeching your mercy and compassion to bestow the qi of the Jade Clarity Dao and the wondrous radiance of the Numinous Treasure, illuminating the ten directions and dispelling the darkness of the nine prisons. May the departed, [Name], along with their nine ancestral generations and seven lineages, their karmic kin from countless kalpas, and all suffering beings of the six paths and four modes of birth—every shade and spirit of the unseen realms—be bathed in this sacred qi, awakening their innate goodness. May their long-accumulated grievances and transgressions dissolve in an instant.

Your servant respectfully invokes the Flying Celestial Envoys of the Ten Directions, the Jade Lads and Jade Maidens of Salvation, to ascend to the Golden Gates and Jade Steps of the Three Heavens, and request the issuance of the Primordial Mandate of the Origin and the True Talisman of Salvation. Let these be proclaimed to the Heavenly, Earthly, and Water Officials of the Ten Directions, the Three Realms, and the Boundless Divine Realms; to the registers of yin and yang transgressions; to the Three Bureaus and Nine Offices; the hundred and twenty courts; the Northern Capital of Fengdu; the inner and outer palaces and caverns; the Avīci Hell and the Uninterrupted Hells; the great and small Iron Enclosures; the twelve river sources; the courts of the Yellow Springs; the Nine Dark Realms and Five Sacred Peaks; the wardens of punishment and retribution; the Five Sufferings and Three Paths; all the great hells; the Five Paths’ central bureaus; and the underworld offices of enforcement. By the radiance of this talisman, may iron cities crumble, torments cease, shackles and fetters fall away, and imprisoned souls be freed. May furnaces and bronze pillars transform into groves of kalpavriksha, boiling cauldrons into lotus pools, rivers of ash and embers into clear ice, mountains of swords and blades into jeweled trees. May the blazing infernos of the flaming hells and the searing peaks of diamond mountains be stilled, grievances resolved, enmities reconciled, evil roots severed, and sinful records expunged. May all departed souls be pardoned, and may the countless suffering beings of the unseen realms attain freedom. May wandering spirits and sunken souls each achieve liberation.

Further, I implore that a sagacious decree be issued to the Azure Bureau, opening the Purple Yang Jade Casket to reveal the name of the Compassionate Savior of Manifest Transformation. May the Dharma flow throughout the ten directions, and may all beings return to refuge. May the gates of the Dao be flung wide, and may the burdened households be swiftly delivered. Thus, may the virtuous be enveloped in the mist of auspicious clouds, and may the numinous efficacy be abundantly manifest. May all equally partake in the blessings of creation, serving as a sign of your boundless grace.

Your foolish servant, relying upon the Direct Envoys of the Two Bureaus, the Orthodox Unity Merit Officers, the Left and Right Bureau Envoys, the Yin-Yang Spirit Talisman Clerks, the Scarlet Talisman Chariot Clerks, the Gale Courier Clerks, the Post-Horse Petition Clerks, the Flying Dragon Mount Clerks, the Phoenix Mounts for Petition Delivery, the Cloud Dragon Mounts for Petition Ascent, the Wind-Swift Mounts for Petition Dispatch, the Divine Dragon Mounts for Imperial Petitions, and the Flying Dragon and Flying Tiger Mounts for Memorial Submission—each accompanied by two attendants—now dispatches them.

On behalf of the sponsor of this retreat, [Name], I present this *Petition to Break Open Fengdu and Unseal the Dao of Merit*, submitting it to the Courts of the Three Heavens. I humbly pray that the celestial grace may grant its response.

With awe and reverence, I prostrate myself, bowing my head to the ground in repeated obeisance, and respectfully submit this petition.

[Three blank lines]

Your servant, [Surname, Name], of [State, County, Township, Village, Temple, and Retreat], hereby performs this rite of burning and cultivation.

[Three blank lines]

To the Supreme, Formless, Nameless, Void, and Spontaneous Utmost True Great Dao, the Most High and Mysterious Venerable One, the Golden Gates and Seven Jeweled Jade Steps of the Celestial Palace.

[Three blank lines]

Presented on the [Day] of the [Month] in the [Year] of the [Celestial Stem-Branch], at [Location].

**Instructions for Writing the Petition:**
This petition shall be written on yellow paper in vermilion ink. The paper shall be one chi, one cun, and six fen in height, with each line one cun and two fen in width. The text shall be written in single columns, with each line containing seventeen characters. On the first sheet, the back shall have two lines, leaving the third line blank before writing the title of the petition in an overlapping manner. Below this, write: *"Your humble servant, [Name], prostrates himself in awe and reverence, bowing his head to the ground in repeated obeisance."*

This line shall not be written on the back. The length may vary as needed. On the fourth line, write *"respectfully submits this petition"* (上言), indented one cun from the title. This line shall then be written on the back with seventeen characters. From *"respectfully submits this petition"* onward, each line shall follow the prescribed format, leaving half a space at the top and ensuring no continuation at the bottom.

The name of the petitioner shall be written as a single character, without splitting it across lines. Characters such as *ghost* (鬼), *inauspicious* (凶), *death* (死), *thief* (贼), or any other ill-omened words shall not appear at the top of a line. Conversely, characters such as *immortal* (仙), *person* (人), *life* (生), or other auspicious words shall not appear at the bottom of a line.

At the conclusion, append the following:
*"I humbly beseech the Supreme Mystery to distinguish and heed this plea. Your foolish servant relies upon the Direct Envoys of the Two Bureaus, the Orthodox Unity Merit Officers, the Left and Right Bureau Envoys, the Yin-Yang Spirit Talisman Clerks, the Scarlet Talisman Chariot Clerks, the Gale Courier Clerks, the Post-Horse Petition Clerks, the Flying Dragon Mount Clerks, the Phoenix Mounts for Petition Delivery, the Cloud Dragon Mounts for Petition Ascent, the Wind-Swift Mounts for Petition Dispatch, the Divine Dragon Mounts for Imperial Petitions, and the Flying Dragon and Flying Tiger Mounts for Memorial Submission—each accompanied by two attendants—to dispatch them."*

*"On behalf of the sponsor of this retreat, [Name], I present this [Title] Petition, submitting it to the Courts of the Three Heavens. I humbly pray that the celestial grace may grant its response."*

*"With awe and reverence, I prostrate myself, bowing my head to the ground in repeated obeisance, and respectfully submit this petition."*

The words *"submit this petition"* (以闻) shall be indented one character from the preceding line, with three blank lines separating them from *"bowing his head to the ground in repeated obeisance"* (再拜). The petitioner’s name, [Surname, Name], along with their affiliation to [State, County, Township, Village, Temple, and Retreat], shall be written starting from the middle of the line and extending to the bottom, aligning with the edge of the paper.

chunks.original_text: 又空三行迭写：大道衔太上无形无名虚无自然至真大道无上玄尊金阙七宝玉陛下，只背书四寸八分。 又空三行自半行写太岁某年某月某日於某处拜上，其下与纸下头相平，太岁以后皆空纸矣。 书章不隔日，填大道衔不隔时，故留某时及陛下一点及以闻字内耳。 字一直笔未填，至校章时方填也。 章可漏，上写大道卫具法位衔，臣姓某章奏，谨封方函。 上写馑馑上诣三天门，下具法师衔位，臣姓某馑重封入章在函内。 章函长一尺二寸，阔一寸八分，以青紧线三度缠之，其十字结处及两头，并贴纸印封之，又入青纸方函写如前方函式，前后以袱包之，此封章法也。 素车白马章 臣赋性迂疏，禀姿愚拙，职忝司於济度，诚敢息於关闻，宜冀高明，曲原狂斐。 臣谨据入意，臣职惟领教，理难抑违，谨涓今月某日为始，就某处肃建玄坛，依按真科次第修奉。 臣切惟九幽六洞三官北酆，冥路幽关，职司考对，匪藉苍穹之宣告，曷令部卫於形魂。 谨为拜章一通，上闻三天，伏望慈悲，曲垂矜悯，特降玉清道炁，灵宝妙光，照耀阴乡，焕明夜府，即俾亡故某人，洎九玄七祖，亿劫种亲，六道四生，诸类幽爽，兔沦苦趣，各脱拘维，来诣玄坛，证品升度。 臣谨为上请素车白马大将军一十二人，官将一百二十人，九龙符命使者一十二人，官将一百二十人，太玄玉女一十二人，官将一百二十人，太玄直符一十二人，官将一百二十人，上诣三天金阙玉陛下，请降太上赦赦生天宝箓，告下十方三界，无极神乡，北都罗酆，泉曲之府，三官九署，百二十曹，水火阴阳，内外宫洞，三十六狱，无间阿鼻，大小铁围，炎池冰沼，四渎五岳，十二河源，五帝考官，六宫掾吏，巨天力士，执罚神兵，司杀司功，司录司命，主考主罪，主狱主非，四明宾公，天门庭长，十宫六洞，五帝大魔，凕泠大神，五道都府，幽台冥缘，长夜鬼官，无量阴曹，咸令知委遵承。 今来建坛之所颁行符命，侍卫送迎，疾令上件亡魂，众苦荡除，出离地狱，永辞幽夜，睹见光明，黑簿烧焚，业根披散，参朝玄座，受炼更生，以为效信。 开通道路章 臣惟蠢浊，性禀颛蒙，冒领玄阶，亶县洪造，敢竭再三之读，庸抒万一之忱。 臣谨据意忱，臣职惟领教，理难抑违，谨涓今月某日为始，就某处肃建玄坛，依按真科次第修奉。 臣切虑魂魄，爽识来往，经由道路关津，或生拘障，非赖上玄之诰命，曷令阡陌之开通？ 谨为拜章一通，上闻三天，伏望慈悲，曲垂矜悯，特降玉清道气，灵宝妙光，开辟幽途，光明无极，即俾亡故某人洎九玄七祖，亿劫种亲，六道四生，诸类幽爽，径离所部来觐斋坛，释罪通幽，朝真受炼。 臣谨为上请太玄直符，太乙使者，五帝直符，十天传言骑吏，玄都金龙茭龙驿吏，玉龙飞龙驿吏各一十二人，官将各一百二十人，上诣三天金阙玉陛下，请降东华青官九龙符命，紫阳宝节，五方生炁，十天宝符，洞朗幽阴，开明长夜，告下天牢地狱，水府阴曹，冥局土司，泉曲六道，北酆九垒，三官九幽，五岳十宫，九州社令，洞天福地，考校曹僚，蒿里丈人，丘丞墓伯，河侯河缘，土下官君，岁德尊神，山林孟长，泉源溪涧，冥路幽关，血食神司，城隍里域，社庙土地，一切主曹，咸禀天符，遵依告戒，除冤拔罪，启路开肩，释放上件亡魂，整肃形仪，经历次第，来诣坛席，听法参真，传授戒符，领沾功德，幽夜不经於险阻，冥关克遂於逍遥，召摄无拘，以符效信。

---

Three blank lines follow, then the text is written in staggered form:
*"The Great Dao bears the title: 'The Supreme, Formless, Nameless, Void, and Spontaneous Utmost True Great Dao, the Most High and Mysterious August One of the Golden Watchtower and Seven Jeweled Jade Palace.'"*
This line shall be written on the reverse side, measuring four inches and eight fen in length.

Three blank lines follow, then from the middle of the line is written:
*"In the year of the Great Year [Year], the [Month] month, [Day] day, at [Location], respectfully submitted."*
The remainder of the line shall align with the bottom edge of the paper, leaving all space after the year of the Great Year blank.

The petition must not be written across days, and the Great Dao’s title must not be filled in across hours. Thus, the hour, the dot after "Palace," and the character *"submit"* within *"submit this petition"* are left blank. These shall remain unfilled until the petition is reviewed, at which time they are completed.

If the petition risks delay, at the top write:
*"By the protective authority of the Great Dao’s office, [Surname, Name] submits this petition."*
The envelope shall be sealed with a square case.

At the top of the envelope write:
*"Respectfully delivered to the Gates of the Three Heavens."*
At the bottom, list the title and office of the Dharma Master, followed by:
*"[Surname, Name] respectfully seals this petition with reverence."*
The petition is then placed inside the envelope.

The petition envelope shall be one foot and two inches in length and one inch and eight fen in width. It shall be bound three times with green silk thread, with the cross-knot and both ends sealed with paper and stamped. It shall then be placed inside a square green paper envelope, following the same format as the outer envelope. The entire package shall be wrapped in cloth—this is the method for sealing petitions.

---

**Petition for the White Horse and Plain Chariot**

Your servant, by nature dull and clumsy, endowed with foolish simplicity, holds the office of salvation yet dares not neglect his duty to report. I humbly beseech the exalted and enlightened to graciously pardon my reckless presumption.

In accordance with the intent of the sponsor, and as my office entails the transmission of the teachings, I cannot justly refuse. Thus, I reverently select this [Day] day of the present [Month] month to solemnly establish a sacred altar at [Location], proceeding in accordance with the true precepts and their prescribed order.

I earnestly reflect: the Nine Dark Realms, Six Caverns, Three Officials, and Northern Fengdu; the shadowy paths and hidden passes of the underworld—all are governed by officials who examine and judge. Without the proclamation of the Azure Vault, how could the spirits and souls of the departed be released from their bonds?

I respectfully submit this petition to the Courts of the Three Heavens, humbly beseeching compassion and merciful pity. May the Dao-qi of the Jade Clarity and the wondrous light of the Numinous Treasure descend to illuminate the dark realms, brightening the nightly abodes. Thereby, may the deceased [Name], together with the nine generations of ancestors, the seven lineages of kin, all karmic relations across kalpas, the six paths and four modes of birth, and every class of suffering shade—be freed from their fetters of suffering. May they come before the sacred altar to receive rank and ascend through salvation.

I reverently invoke:
- Twelve Great Generals of the White Horse and Plain Chariot, with one hundred twenty officials and generals;
- Twelve Envoys of the Nine Dragon Talismanic Mandate, with one hundred twenty officials and generals;
- Twelve Jade Maidens of the Supreme Mystery, with one hundred twenty officials and generals;
- Twelve Direct Talismanic Envoys of the Supreme Mystery, with one hundred twenty officials and generals.

May they ascend to the Golden Watchtower and Jade Palace of the Three Heavens, beseeching the descent of the *Precious Register of the Most High for Pardon and Ascent to Heaven*. Let this proclamation be issued to the ten directions, three realms, boundless divine realms, Northern Fengdu, the Courts of the Yellow Springs, the Three Officials and Nine Bureaus, the one hundred twenty offices, the palaces of water and fire, yin and yang, the inner and outer caverns, the thirty-six prisons, the Avīci Hell of Uninterrupted Suffering, the great and lesser Iron Enclosures, the pools of flame and lakes of ice, the Four Waterways and Five Sacred Peaks, the twelve river sources, the examining officials of the Five Emperors, the clerks of the Six Palaces, the mighty heavenly warriors, the divine soldiers who execute punishments, the recorders of merit and fate, the judges of crimes and sins, the wardens of prisons and transgressions, the Four Luminous Lords, the Gatekeepers of Heaven, the Ten Palaces and Six Caverns, the Great Demons of the Five Emperors, the mighty spirits of the Netherworld, the Five Paths and Capital Offices, the Terrace of Darkness and the Borders of the Underworld, the ghostly officials of the Eternal Night, and the infinite yin courts—all are commanded to heed and obey.

At the site of this altar’s establishment, talismanic mandates shall be issued, and guards shall escort and receive the aforementioned departed souls. May all sufferings be swept away, the hells be departed, the eternal night be left behind, and the light be beheld. May the Black Registers be burned, the roots of karmic debt be scattered, and the souls ascend to the sacred seat to undergo refinement and rebirth, as proof of efficacy.

---

**Petition for the Opening of Roads**

Your servant, dull-witted and benighted, presumptuously holds a sacred office, undeserving of such great favor. I dare to exhaust my humble devotion, offering but a fraction of my sincerity.

In accordance with the sponsor’s intent, and as my office entails the transmission of the teachings, I cannot justly refuse. Thus, I reverently select this [Day] day of the present [Month] month to solemnly establish a sacred altar at [Location], proceeding in accordance with the true precepts and their prescribed order.

I deeply consider: the wandering souls and scattered consciousnesses, as they traverse the roads and passes, may encounter obstacles. Without the edict of the Supreme Mystery, how could the paths be opened?

I respectfully submit this petition to the Courts of the Three Heavens, humbly beseeching compassion and merciful pity. May the Dao-qi of the Jade Clarity and the wondrous light of the Numinous Treasure descend to open the shadowy paths, illuminating the boundless dark. Thereby, may the deceased [Name], together with the nine generations of ancestors, the seven lineages of kin, all karmic relations across kalpas, the six paths and four modes of birth, and every class of suffering shade—depart from their abodes and come to attend the altar. May their sins be absolved, the dark realms be traversed, and the true ones be approached for refinement.

I reverently invoke:
- Twelve Direct Talismanic Envoys of the Supreme Mystery;
- Twelve Envoys of the Great Unity;
- Twelve Direct Talismanic Envoys of the Five Emperors;

chunks.original_text: 臣谨据入意，臣职惟领教，理难抑违，谨涓某月某日为始，就某处肃建玄坛，依按真科，次第修奉。 臣切虑上件亡魂，幽关闭郁，阴垢缠罹，欲期容体之澄清，必赖神泉之荡涤，谨为拜章一通，上闻三天，伏望慈悲，俯垂矜悯，特降玉清道炁，灵宝妙光，浃灌兰池，辉华沐浴，即俾亡故某洎九玄七祖，亿劫种亲，六道四生，诸类幽爽，镯消氛翳，洁湛形神，六府洞明，一尘不染。 臣谨为上请东井玉女，华池夫人，洗擢玉女，沐浴君吏，日月童子各一人，五方解秽君将吏各一百二十人，一合下降，神化东井黄华之池，西田流汨之沼，汲取石景王肥，黄华神水，五方正炁，日月芝英，甘露金津，云腴玉醴，沐浴所度，亡魂灌炼，罪尘涤除，障垢挣结，节胞胎之秽，清冤债烦恼之氛。 又为上请东方青灵始老，哺饴以九炁之青津，南方丹灵真老，哺饴以三炁之丹华，西方皓灵黄老，哺饴以七炁之素浆，北方五灵玄老，哺饴以五炁之玄滋，中央黄灵玄老，哺饴以一炁之黄英，定魄安魂，自生五脏。 又为上请金刚百炼，玉液千和，太白流光，元皇散精，解除郁烦，去荡滓秽，身心清净，智慧洞明。 又为上请天医神吏，尚药灵官，三五功曹，天医博士，砭石小吏，敷药灵童，密运九转芝英，五色神药，布散经络藏府之中，救疗生前荣卫之病，即使上件亡魂宿患清平，沈疯痊愈，精神复旧，肢体洁清，受化更生，以为效信。 溥度幽魂章 臣忝列真阶，莫裨玄化，矢心领教，励志度人，荐干咫尺之威，庸露亿千之捆。 臣谨据斋意，臣职惟领教，理难抑违，谨涓今月某日为始，就某处肃建玄坛，次第修奉。 臣切见冥关幽路，滞魄穷魂，或水火飘焚，或兵戈谋害，或木石损磕，或挺刃刑伤，或久抱饥寒，或曾遭鸩毒，或寇盗杀戮，或蛇虎吞残，或王法凌迟，或震雷瞋击，或覆车坠马，或自缢投河，或他境流亡，或从军倾毙，或鬼神拘击，或冤对勾连，或疮跛聋盲，或瘴瘟瘫症，或胎产殒命，或疾病夭伤，或宿抱怨嗟，或常怀忧忿，或玄恩未度，或常赦不原，孤滞千名，沈沦万姓，山林寄影，郊野潜形，流浪无归，实堪怜恤，惟黄录昭天漏，泉之泽正，阴关求哀，望度之机。 臣虽禀承玉符，冒颁大赦，尚虑功德未褊幽冥，谨遵无量度人之道，取今月某日夜，修设玄都大献，玉山净供，摄召九州十界六道四生诸类伤亡，无边爽识，享食受炼，脱苦生仙，自非大道之慈怜，曷俾众魂之解脱？ 谨为拜章一通，上闻三天，伏望慈悲，特垂矜悯，颁降玉清道炁，灵宝妙光，遍满十方，辉明九野，上极无上，下极无下，接引万类，均赴法筵，涤罪解冤，炼形受化。 臣谨为上请玉清淇津大梵灵官，青玄黄录救苦灵官功曹，玉童玉女，各三十二人，仙吏一百人，上诣三天金阙玉陛下，请降元皇慈悲，吉祥甘露，责持天慈，赦宥宝幡，一合下降，即为咒洒甘露，溥化斛筵，周徧虚空，无穷无尽，哺饴众爽，充足丰盈，随感来饮，悉皆饱满。 仰承元始符命，金箓白简，救苦真符，长生灵符，太上生天宝箓，东华青宫，九龙符命，宝光罗络，拔度幽沈，不分六道四生，咸受黄箓冶炼，即使未度者度，未生者生，未升者升，未化者化，合符膺券，返阴还阳，超凌人天，以为效信。

**Purification and Healing Petition (Continued)**

This humble servant, in accordance with the petitioner’s intent and bound by the duty of transmitting the teachings, finds it impossible to refuse. Thus, beginning on the [day] of the [month], I shall reverently establish a sacred altar at [location], proceeding in accordance with the true rites and their prescribed order.

I deeply consider that the aforementioned departed souls, confined in the gloom of the underworld and ensnared by yin filth, may only achieve clarity of form and spirit through the purifying flow of divine springs. Therefore, I humbly present this petition to the Three Heavens, beseeching your compassion to look upon them with mercy. May you specially bestow the Dao-qi of Jade Clarity and the wondrous radiance of Numinous Treasure, immersing the Orchid Pool in their effulgence, that the departed—[name] and their nine generations of ancestors, seven lineages of kin, all karmic relations across kalpas, and the myriad categories of suffering spirits in the six paths and four modes of birth—may have their turbid obstructions dissolved, their forms and spirits cleansed and luminous, their six viscera illuminated, and not a speck of dust remain.

I reverently invoke:
- The Jade Maiden of the Eastern Well,
- The Lady of the Flowery Pool,
- The Jade Maidens of Washing and Cleansing,
- The Officers of the Bathing Lords,
- One Sun Child and one Moon Child,
- One hundred and twenty Officers of the Five Directions’ Purification, to descend as one.

May they transform the Yellow Flower Pool of the Eastern Well and the Flowing Marsh of the Western Fields, drawing the Fat of the Stone Radiance King, the divine waters of the Yellow Flower, the true qi of the Five Directions, the sacred herbs of the sun and moon, the golden nectar of sweet dew, and the jade liqueur of cloud marrow. May these bathe and refine the departed souls, washing away sinful dust, dissolving karmic grime, purging the filth of the womb and birth, and clearing the miasma of grievances, debts, and afflictions.

Furthermore, I invoke:
- The Azure Spirit Elder of the East, to nourish with the ninefold azure essence,
- The Cinnabar Spirit Perfected of the South, to nourish with the threefold cinnabar splendor,
- The Luminous Yellow Elder of the West, to nourish with the sevenfold white nectar,
- The Mystic Spirit Elder of the North, to nourish with the fivefold dark elixir,
- The Yellow Spirit Elder of the Center, to nourish with the singular yellow essence,
that their hun-souls may be stabilized, their po-souls pacified, and their five viscera naturally regenerated.

I further invoke:
- The hundredfold-tempered Vajra,
- The thousandfold-harmonized Jade Elixir,
- The flowing radiance of Venus,
- The scattered essence of the Primordial Sovereign,
to dispel stagnation and vexation, purge dregs and filth, and render body and mind pure, wisdom luminous.

I also invoke:
- The Divine Physicians of Heaven,
- The Numinous Officers of Medicines,
- The Three and Five Merit Officials,
- The Celestial Medical Masters,
- The Stone-Needle Lesser Officers,
- The Medicine-Spreading Divine Lads,
to secretly circulate the ninefold-transformed sacred herbs and the five-colored divine medicines, dispersing them through the meridians and viscera. May they heal the ailments of the departed souls’ former lives, their chronic afflictions, and lingering maladies, restoring their spirits to wholeness, their limbs to purity, and granting them rebirth through transformation as proof of efficacy.

**Petition for the Universal Salvation of Suffering Souls**

This unworthy servant, though ranked among the true immortals, has done little to aid the Dao’s transformation. Yet I pledge my heart to the teachings and strive to deliver beings. I dare to present this humble offering before your awe-inspiring presence, prostrating myself in boundless reverence.

In accordance with the intent of this fast, bound by the duty of transmitting the teachings, I find it impossible to refuse. Thus, beginning on the [day] of this month, I shall reverently establish a sacred altar at [location] and proceed in due order.

I have observed that in the dark passes of the underworld, countless lost souls linger—some swept away by water or fire, some slain by weapons or treachery, some crushed by trees or stones, some executed by the blade, some long afflicted by hunger and cold, some poisoned by toxins, some slaughtered by bandits, some devoured by serpents or beasts, some subjected to the cruelest punishments, some struck down by thunder, some crushed in carriage falls or horseback tumbles, some hanged or drowned, some perished in foreign lands, some fallen in battle, some seized by spirits, some entangled in karmic grievances, some maimed by sores, lameness, deafness, or blindness, some stricken by miasmas, plagues, or paralysis, some lost in childbirth, some cut down by illness, some burdened by ancient resentments, some consumed by sorrow and anger, some yet unenlightened by the Dao’s grace, some never pardoned despite repeated amnesties. Countless names remain forsaken, myriad lineages sunk in suffering. They haunt the mountains and forests, lurk in the wilds, drift without refuge—truly pitiable. Only through the Yellow Register’s revelation of Heaven’s mercy and the underworld’s compassionate decree may they glimpse the hope of deliverance.

Though I have received the jade talismans and proclaimed the great amnesty, I fear the merit may not yet extend to the dark realms. Therefore, in accordance with the *Dao of Delivering the Limitless*, on the night of the [day] of this month, I shall conduct the Great Offering of the Mystic Capital, presenting pure offerings upon the Jade Mountain. I shall summon the suffering souls of all categories—those slain across the nine provinces and ten realms, the six paths and four modes of birth—inviting them to partake of the feast, undergo refinement, escape suffering, and ascend as immortals. Without the great Dao’s compassion, how could these multitudes attain liberation?

I humbly present this petition to the Three Heavens, beseeching your mercy to look upon them with pity. May you bestow the Dao-qi of Jade Clarity and the wondrous radiance of Numinous Treasure, filling the ten directions and illuminating the nine wilds, reaching from the highest heavens to the lowest depths, guiding all beings to the Dharma feast. May their sins be washed away, their grievances dissolved, their forms refined, and their natures transformed.

I reverently invoke:
- The Great Brahma Numinous Officers of Jade Clarity’s Lustral Waters,
- The Azure Mystery and Yellow Register Officers of Salvation and Merit,
- Thirty-two Jade Lads and Maidens,
- One hundred Immortal Clerks,
to ascend to the Golden Gates and Jade Steps of the Three Heavens, beseeching the descent of the Primordial Sovereign’s compassion, the auspicious sweet dew, and the banners of pardon, bearing the Heavenly Mercy.

May they descend as one, chanting spells to scatter the sweet dew, universally transforming the feast’s vessels, filling the boundless void. May all suffering spirits partake to their fill, their hunger sated, their thirst quenched, each responding to the call.

I rely upon:
- The Mandate of the Primordial Beginning,
- The Golden Register and White Tablet,
- The True Talisman of Salvation,
- The Luminous Talisman of Eternal Life,
- The Precious Register of Ascending to Heaven,
- The Eastern Flowery Azure Palace,
- The Nine Dragon Mandates,
- The Jeweled Net of Radiance,
to deliver all sunken souls, regardless of their path or mode of birth, refining them through the Yellow Register. May the undelivered be delivered, the unborn be born, the unascended ascend, the untransformed be transformed. May they receive their talismans and contracts, return from yin to yang, and transcend the realms of humans and heavens as proof of efficacy.

chunks.original_text: 九炼生仙升度亡魂章 臣道未通玄，德难入妙，屡为人而造请，每拊己以凌兢，仰藉汪涵，俯加原贷。 臣谨据斋意，臣职惟领教，理难抑违，谨涓今月某日为始，就某处肃建玄坛，次第修奉。 臣切虑上件亡魂，阴暗久沦，阳光易隔，匪藉黄华之冶炼，曷令碧落之登真？ 谨取某日夜，遵依灵宝大法，无量度人，开廓五文，奉行九炼，先为拜章一通，上闻三天，伏望慈悲，曲垂矜悯，特降玉清道炁，灵宝妙光，灌注玄坛，辉明洞耀，即俾上件亡魂，身沐灵光，心涤阴秽，水火炼质，表裹周圆。 谨为上请南宫度人不死尊神，南极长生大君，度世司马大神，好生韩君丈人真君，南上司命司录，延寿益算度厄尊神，回骸起死无量度人真君，度魂上生南宫真君，奉为亡故某人注算金文，定名玉简。 又为上请太乙救苦仙吏，金阙化身仙吏，朱陵度命仙吏，逍遥快乐仙吏，宝华圆满仙吏，炼度玉司，灵宝仙官，玉童玉女，将军使者，功曹主吏，上诣三天金阙玉陛下，请降元始符命，金录白简，长生灵符，内音玉字，赤书真文，上生黄录宝诰，下临坛席，奉为亡故某人破酆都之秽浊，荡泉壤之幽阴，削落业根，焚烧罪籍，飞度五户，斩灭三尸，建立法桥，回旋云界，启黄华之宝井，立流火之神庭，陶冶阳灵，荡除阴翳，上登朱府，下入开光，复返万神，重生九炁，披登天之法服，驾莲花之宝与，俓诣天门，朝礼金阙，逍遥自在，与道合真，永无轮转之忧，常履熙明之运。 酆都赦罪章明真斋用 臣生居浊世，运际昌期，佩箓参玄，传经悟道，誓度人而领教，庶补过以立功，凡有皈投，敢忘关告。 臣谨据斋意，臣切惟三官九署，百二十曹，六洞十宫，三十六狱，铁围元间，泉曲河源，五苦三途，九幽五岳，典司宪令，考对愆尤。 愚俗众生，罔明正理，造冤积业，抱恶逞非，致使名隶北酆，魂归幽夜，拘闭阴狱，囚系终天，痛苦备婴，莫由解脱，匪赖玄虚之曲赦，曷令罪报之镯除？ 谨为拜章一通，上闻三天，伏望大德好生，至仁无外，特降玉清道炁，灵宝妙光，朗映十方，焕明三界，冥关幽路，照耀辉华，地累罪魂，应时清净。 即俾上件亡魂，出离夜壑，睹见晨阳，开发善心，自识宿命，悔过进善，脱苦超生。 臣谨为上请降真召灵符吏，降真召灵童子各一人，特为亡故某人恭请大极真符，告下东极天中长乐宫内大慈仁者，寻声赴感太乙救苦天尊，希降威神，慧光普照，十方世界，重阴极垒，北都寒池，一一狱中，悉成阳境，铁城摧毁，枷锁脱除，赦宥亡故某人万罪，荡除冤仇，和释不经，地狱睹见，光明仰赖。 天尊上圣，召十方飞天神王救苦真人，救苦童子，青玄玉女，遍下幽狱，降慈悲之法雨，酒甘露之宝浆，即得冰雪生春，炎姻息焰，刀化玉树，剑变骞林，寒冰瞑泠，顿除凛冽，擭汤铜柱，悉获清凉，狱卒牛头，俱生善念，铜蛇铁狗，永断恶绿，曹局除考对之名，司案焚业报之字，以至驱雷役电，涟汲淇波，负石担沙，天圆转匝，穿地引水，运风扫山，谪役囚徒，均承妙化，断地逮役，度上南宫，蒙如恳切之祈，允拜提携之造。 沐浴炼度章 臣尘埃贱质，草莽微生，误沐甄陶，俾登阶品，直藉圆成之造，敢忘报称之私，誓拯沈沦，庶敦勋行。

**Chapter on Ninefold Refinement for Ascending as Immortals and Delivering the Departed Spirits**

This humble servant’s Dao remains unpervaded by the Mysterious, his virtue far from attaining subtlety. Repeatedly, he petitions on behalf of others, yet trembles in self-reproach, ever reliant upon boundless grace, ever entreating lenient forbearance.

In accordance with the intent of this fast, this servant’s duty lies solely in presiding over the teachings—how could he dare refuse? Thus, beginning on the appointed day of this month, he reverently establishes a Mysterious Altar at the designated place, proceeding in due order with the rites.

This servant deeply fears that the aforementioned departed spirits, long sunken in yin’s darkness, are easily severed from yang’s light. Without the refining power of the Yellow Flower, how may they ascend to the Azure Vault as perfected beings?

On the chosen night, he shall follow the *Lingbao* Great Rites of Boundless Deliverance, unfolding the Five Scripts and performing the Ninefold Refinement. First, he presents a memorial, ascending it to the Three Heavens, humbly beseeching compassion to incline toward mercy. May the Jade Clarity’s Dao-qi and the *Lingbao*’s wondrous radiance descend, suffusing the Mysterious Altar with luminous brilliance. Thus may the aforementioned departed spirits bathe their forms in sacred light, their hearts cleansed of yin’s filth, their essences refined through water and fire, their inner and outer selves made whole.

He reverently invokes:
- The Deathless Venerable of the Southern Palace, Deliverer of Humankind,
- The Great Lord of Longevity of the Southern Culmen,
- The Marshal of Deliverance, Controller of the World,
- The True Lord Han Jun, Lover of Life,
- The Registrars of Life and Destiny of the Southern Bureau,
- The Venerable Deliverer from Calamity, Restorer of Bones and Reviver of the Dead,
- The Boundless Deliverer of Humankind, True Lord of the Southern Palace,
to inscribe the departed’s allotted lifespan in golden script and fix their names upon jade tablets.

He further invokes:
- The Immortal Officers of the Great Unity’s Salvation,
- The Immortal Officers of the Golden Watchtower’s Manifestations,
- The Immortal Officers of the Vermilion Mound’s Deliverance,
- The Immortal Officers of Carefree Joy,
- The Immortal Officers of Precious Flower’s Perfection,
- The Jade Bureau of Refinement and Deliverance,
- The Immortal Officers of the *Lingbao*,
- Jade Lads and Jade Maidens,
- Generals and Envoys,
- Merit Officers and Chief Scribes,
to ascend to the Golden Watchtower’s Jade Steps beneath the Three Heavens, beseeching the descent of:
- The Primordial Beginning’s Mandate,
- The Golden Register and White Tablet,
- The Talisman of Eternal Life,
- The Jade Characters of Inner Sound,
- The Vermilion Script of True Writ,
- The Yellow Register’s Precious Edict of Ascension,
to the altar’s precincts.

Thus may the departed, surnamed so-and-so, be delivered from Fengdu’s defilement and the netherworld’s gloom, their karmic roots severed, their sinful records burned. May the Five Portals be traversed, the Three Corpses slain, the Dharma Bridge erected, and the cloud realms turned back. May the Yellow Flower’s precious well be opened, the Flowing Fire’s divine court established, their yang spirits refined, and yin’s shadows dispelled. May they ascend to the Vermilion Palace above, enter the Radiant Opening below, restore the myriad spirits, and regenerate the Nine Qi. Clad in the vestments of celestial ascent, riding the lotus’s precious chariot, may they proceed to the Heavenly Gates, pay homage at the Golden Watchtower, roam freely in bliss, and merge with the Dao in truth, forever freed from the sorrow of rebirth, ever abiding in the radiance of flourishing fortune.

---

**Chapter on the Fengdu Pardon of Sins for the Illumination of the True Fast**

This servant, born in a defiled age yet blessed to live in an era of prosperity, bears the registers and delves into the Mysterious, transmits the scriptures and awakens to the Dao. He vows to deliver humankind and uphold the teachings, striving to atone for faults and establish merit. How could he forget to report and petition for all who seek refuge?

In accordance with the intent of this fast, this servant reflects: the Three Bureaus and Nine Offices, the One Hundred Twenty Courts, the Six Caves and Ten Palaces, the Thirty-Six Prisons, the Iron Enclosure’s primordial bounds, the Yellow Springs’ winding depths, the Five Sufferings and Three Paths, the Nine Netherworlds and Five Peaks—all govern decrees and examine transgressions.

Foolish worldly beings, ignorant of right principle, accumulate karmic debts and indulge in evil, committing wrongs. Thus their names are bound to the Northern Fengdu, their souls consigned to the netherworld’s night, imprisoned in yin’s dungeons, fettered for eternity, enduring unrelenting torment with no hope of release. Without the Mysterious and Void’s gracious pardon, how could their sinful retributions be dissolved?

He presents a memorial, ascending it to the Three Heavens, humbly beseeching the Great Virtue’s love for life, whose boundless benevolence extends everywhere. May the Jade Clarity’s Dao-qi and the *Lingbao*’s wondrous radiance descend, illuminating the Ten Directions and brightening the Three Realms. May the netherworld’s gates and shadowed paths gleam with resplendent light, instantly purifying the earth-bound sinful spirits.

Thus may the aforementioned departed spirits emerge from the abyss of night, behold the dawn’s sunlight, awaken their good hearts, recognize their past lives, repent their faults, and advance in virtue, escaping suffering to attain rebirth.

This servant reverently invokes the Talisman Officers of Descending Perfection and Summoning Spirits, along with the Lads of Descending Perfection and Summoning Spirits, each one, to respectfully request the Great Ultimate’s True Talisman. May it be proclaimed to the Great Compassionate One of the Heavenly Center’s Ever-Joyful Palace in the Eastern Culmen, the Heavenly Worthy of Great Unity’s Salvation Who Responds to Cries, to descend with majestic power and radiant wisdom, universally illuminating the Ten Directions’ worlds, the deepest yin’s layered darkness, and the Northern Capital’s icy pools. May every prison become a realm of yang, iron cities crumble, and fetters fall away. May the departed, surnamed so-and-so, be pardoned of all sins, their grievances dissolved, their disputes resolved. May the hells witness this light and rely upon its grace.

May the Heavenly Worthies and Sagely Beings summon the Ten Directions’ Flying Heavenly Kings, the Salvation Perfected, the Salvation Lads, and the Azure Mystery Jade Maidens to descend upon the netherworld’s prisons. May they shower the Dharma’s compassionate rain and sprinkle the sweet dew’s precious nectar, transforming ice and snow into spring, extinguishing flames and smoke. May blades become jade trees, swords turn into forests of *jian* trees, and the cold’s bitter chill instantly vanish. May boiling cauldrons and copper pillars become cool, jailers and Ox-Headed Demons awaken to kindness, and copper serpents and iron dogs forever cease their malevolence. May the courts’ records of interrogation be erased, the bureaus’ ledgers of karmic retribution burned. Even those condemned to:
- driving thunder and wielding lightning,
- dredging the Qi and Ji rivers,
- bearing stones and hauling sand,
- circling the Heavenly Round,
- tunneling earth to draw water,
- harnessing winds to sweep mountains,
shall all partake of the wondrous transformation. May those bound to earthly labor be delivered to the Southern Palace above. In response to these earnest prayers, may they be granted the boon of upliftment.

---

**Chapter on Bathing and Refinement for Deliverance**

This servant, a base being of dust and a humble life of the wilds, was mistakenly shaped by the potter’s hand and elevated to rank. Wholly dependent upon the perfection of the Mysterious Completion, how could he forget his private duty of requital? He vows to rescue the sunken and strive to fulfill meritorious deeds.

chunks.original_text: 臣谨据斋意，臣职惟领教，理难抑违，谨涓今月某日为始，就某处肃建玄坛，依按真科，次第修奉。 臣切惟积夜重泉，冥乡幽路，阴氛萦结，业垢交罹，众生魂堕寒庭，神归夜壑，阴霾混翳，晦浊蒙维，虽已颁告符章，曲行摄召，虑沦幽域，莫遂参朝，自非沐浴於神泉，曷俾形魂之荡涤？ 谨为拜章一通，上闻三天，伏望大德好生，至仁无外，特降玉清道炁，灵宝妙光，洞映兰池，神化玄液，即俾亡故某人澡身浴德，荡垢清尘，洗表裹之昏蒙，除形神之热恼，朝真听法，度命升玄。 臣谨为上请五方五灵童子各五人，解秽君吏各一百二十人，浣濯夫人黄华玉女各一人，应时下降，取黄华神水，炼尸素浆，甘露金津，云腴玉醴，灌注兰汤之中，沐浴亡故某人，湔涤尘劳，消除罪障，五脏六腑，悉得清明，九窍四肢，俱成澄洁。 又为上请主水主火大将军，石景水母，流精玉女，九光童子，火铃灵童，青玄炼魂，应干真众，取南昌朱陵流火之庭，东井黄华流汨之沼，真水真火，一合来下，专为亡故某人炼洗秽氛，陶澄累垢，粒严受度，克应升仙、永证无为，不经轮转。 升度亡灵章 臣陋质何庸，短材无取，师恩赫奕，幸睹希微，帝力辉华，若为报效，期广扬於济度，克昭赞於生成。 臣谨据斋意，臣职惟领教，理难抑违，谨涓今月某日为始，就某处肃建玄坛，依按真科，次第修奉。 臣切惟上件亡魂久沦阴地，获睹阳光，自非度命以反生，曷俾超凌而自在？ 谨为拜章一通，上闻三天，伏望大道好生，至仁无外，特降玉清道炁，灵宝妙光，朗耀玄虚，焕明坛惮，即俾上件亡魂，沐灵光而快乐，乘炼度以逍遥。 臣谨为上请南昌上宫司命君、司录君、延寿君、益算君、度厄君、度人不死君、南极长生君、度世司马君、好生丈人君、回骸起死无量度人君，升度亡故某人，先入黄华宝井，次入流火神庭，濯质荡形，除阴炼秽，抱九天之真炁，灌五帝之灵芒，气象周圆，形神完复，飕车碧落，羽驾太清，升入天门，佩符合券，永无轮转，常获逍遥，受化更生，以为效信。 迁拔亡灵章迁拔道场用 臣福基夙挺，昌运欣逢，佩录进阶，传经受道，深惭赛浅，莫悟希夷，过有贯盈，功无缕积，尚沐生成之泽，俾司济度之科，益勉操修，庸期报称，敬奉词捆，所合奏闻。 臣谨据斋意，臣职惟领教，理难抑违，谨涓今月某日为始，就某处肃建玄坛，依按真科，次第修奉。 臣切惟三官九署，六洞十宫，泉曲河源，北酆东岱，考校善恶，毫发无差，浊世众生，罔知修饰，六根三业，五欲七情，流浪颠冥，驰骋不息，致使魂归幽府，神返幽关，冤仇击萦，曹局推对，悠悠长夜，深可矜怜，自非上圣推恻隐之仁，曷俾下愚免沈沦之苦？ 谨为拜章一通，上闻三天，伏望道德，曲成慈悲，丕冒特降玉清道炁，灵宝妙光，照耀郁单，焕明泽垒，即使亡故某人睹此灵辉，自识宿命，舍恶趋善，脱苦上生。 臣谨为上请太上十二阳门开光童子一十二人，天道功曹一人，九天云路正一功曹九人，南昌上宫扶接引送神童玉女各一百二十人，手执太上迁神符命，开导灵幡，接引所荐亡魂蒙阳光之下烛，指云路以上升，逍遥太空，永无沦坠。 荡涤血湖章血湖道场用

chunks.original_text: 臣尘泥贱类，草莽微生，误玷班联，滥司济度，莫报生成之德，誓宣化育之仁，凡有皈依，敢忘关告。 臣谨挝斋意，臣切念亡故某人三生四负，多积冤愆，六欲七情，易招衅咎，命罹产厄，神堕幽关，北酆东岱之曹，纪录姓字，峡石血湖之狱，考对形魂，抱痛终天，无由解脱，爰念禀生之本始，孰非祖炁之分灵，妄业自招，实堪矜悯，帝恩无外，谅赐哀怜。 谨为拜章一通，上闻三天，伏望垂惠重泉，曲加省览，特降玉清道炁，灵宝妙光，洞映十方，照烛长夜，变阴暗为阳明之境，化血湖为清诤之场，令诸罪人，自识宿命，舍恶趋善，脱苦超生。 臣谨为上请三炁流光符吏，荡涤血湖符吏各一人，官将各二十四人，上诣三天金阙玉陛下，请降三炁流光，真符玉元，荡涤血湖，真符告下，北都罗酆大铁围山，峡石无问、血湖地狱，即冀符光朗耀，阴壤开明，原赦亡故某人洎见禁经产身亡，未得出离者，并与疾除罪簿，落灭恶根，解释冤仇，开通性识，承今符命，获脱冥途，来诣玄坛，闻经听法，全形复质，随果注生。 又念沦染血腥，形神秽浊，来朝三宝，难近天光，谨为上请五方五帝解秽君吏各一人，玉女使者各二十四人，九凤破秽大将军，涤秽大将军，洗秽大将军，灭秽大将军各一人，官将各二十四人，沐浴东井君一人，官将二十四人，洗濯夫人黄华玉女各一人，仙花玉女一百二十人，一合来下，为取黄华神水，炼尸素浆，甘露金津，云腴玉醴，灌注兰汤之内，沐浴亡故某人，洗除产厌，荡涤秽腥，俾令内外光明，形神洁诤，根尘业垢，并与澄清。 又念亡故某人，沦谢之初，自膺痛毒，荣卫伤瘁，未遂安痊，谨为上请天医神吏，尚药灵官，治病功曹，太医博士各一人，一合来下，密运神圣工巧，饵以日精月华，玉芝金醴，五色神丹，救疗诸苦，庶得阴阳通畅，血炁和平，经络还元，魂神澄正，朝真受度，托化人天，永无沦坠之忧，自在光明之界。 更愿灵光伟灿，慧泽周流，业海澄波，血湖息浪，人民品物，并受生成，舒化日於三涂，播仁风於八极。 灭度炼尸生仙章五炼生尸斋用 臣幸藉宿因，滥裨妙化，誓广宣於济度，庸上赞於生成，过有渊陵，功无毫发，尚祈恩需，俯赐包容。 臣伏为先师某人，元命某年月日时生存日佩某经受某录，奉某法补充某职，系某靖焚修。 末学道浅，仙品未充，莫能背土凌空，飞腾霄漠，运应灭度，以某年月日身经太阴，享年几岁，已准三洞仙度品格，衣服枕席，遍篆灵章，卫其尸形，又准灭度五炼生尸，宝经玉字真文，安镇五方、护其神识，练吉迁葬，寄形土官。 未葬更伺练吉寄形土官尤虑生存之日功德未周，恐阻超迈，遂卜今月某日，谨就某处崇建灵宝灭度五炼生尸妙斋二昼夜，期将先师某人扶接引送，返形受生，游行太空。 臣事金阙，臣义同父子，志剧悲惶，孝子云情钟父子志剧悲惶恭按真科次第修奉。 臣切惟三官九府百二十曹，四极明科，三品洞律，昭如日月，威若雷霆，学道参真，易招罪戾，未经赦宥，必堕幽乡，转眼畏途，惟增骇汗。 今先师某人生逢昌运，佩奉玄元，未明修真御景之方，徒抱济物利人之志，元腊节会，禁戒多违，经录法阶，朝修有缺，重以飞章进表，每渍仙真，设醮建斋，或干神吏，致使玄曹毕录，炁簿登书，阳过未原，阴愆莫这，倏忽厌世，遽受沈寥，自非大道广运於慈悲，曷俾后学疾跻於冲蹑？

chunks.original_text: 谨为拜上丹章一通，上闻三天，伏望上圣垂仁，至真矜悯，特降玉清道炁，灵宝妙光，下覆先师某人魂魄尸形，削落愆尤，解除考讼，随光御炁，径上虚无，仍乞告下十方三界，一切真司，特为原赦宿生今世三业六情，洎学道以来无边过咎，并从宽释，移名紫籍，受化更生。 臣谨为上请灵宝落灭恶道灵官三人，官将各一百二十人，断绝地根灵官四人，官将各一百二十人，飞度累户灵官五人，官将各一百二十人，一合下降，为先师某人落灭三恶，斩绝地根，飞度五户，名列太玄，乘景升神，上登无极。 若先师某人魂魄沦坠三涂五苦、六天九幽者，即为度脱，高升上境。 又为上请玄都金龙驿吏一十二人，东华青官九龙符命使者，九天道功曹一人，十方飞天使者十人，官将各一百二十人，上诣三天金阙玉陛下，请降元始符命，金箓白简，长生灵符，东华青宫九龙符命，登真度命，出离生死真符，南昌上宫宝诰，告下三官九署，五帝四司，无鞅阴治，若先师缘公私罪犯，未得解释者，愿乘此仙度功德，悉为赦除，若因三曾九祖亿劫种亲宿对罪绿结衅幽冥者，愿为条录生前建善之功，速为解宥，即冀改易罪籍，定名玉简，迁神度品，高步天衢。 又为上请九天三十二天，五老上帝诸天省府，北斗南辰，日月五星、天曹真众、各降真炁，接引先师某人，荡涤愆瑕，进升道境，复还治职，炁入玄玄，登品成真，永无轮转。 更愿先师某人所属某岳某山，真灵正神，符下九土地官，各依部界，营卫尸形，灾害消除，冢墓宁静，形安神守，魄不敢扬，持节契符，重苏骨肉，形与神合，游宴腾凌，得为神仙，一如五炼生尸经旨，永奉玄恩，以为效信。 升度仙魂章师友命过用 臣缀武班联，滥司济度，叨恩逾分，拊己知元，誓弘洞辅之仁，密赞生成之德，尚祈洪造俯鉴丹忱。 臣谨据斋意，臣职惟领教，理难抑违，切念某人幸藉夙缘，叨承玄荫，佩箓奉法，受经学真，易涉尘寰，未明窍妙，建斋设醮，每冒威仪，拜表上章，实乖俯仰，破斋犯戒，纵业逞情，常失天和，多循人欲，三元五腊，莫谨朝修，甲子庚申，曾无忏谢，过书黑簿，名录玄曹，未能坐脱，立忘升神御炁，运应灭度，身经太阴，莫测升沈，倏经旬朔。 弟子云，臣情钟父子，志剧悲惶。 弟子云，臣义均师友，志剧悲惶，自非上圣垂慈，高真孚佑，俯矜愚昧，力赐饼蒙，何以洗洗前愆，导迎新既？ 庸是不揆狂斐，谨为拜章一通，上闻三天，伏望大慈曲成，至仁无外，特降敕命，行下十方三界，合属去处，将某人浩劫以来，禀生之后，应有过犯，并与赦除，即俾定录青宫，移名朱府，形神混合，炁象周圆，随我学功，校勋迁赏，复还治职，炁入玄玄，克为圣君金阙之臣，大扬圣化，绿运不绝，身得神仙，逍遥上清，永无轮转。 断绝复连章度星斋用 臣性识迂愚，资材短陋，缀斑联而领教，誓济度以推仁，凡有皈依，敢忘关奏？ 臣谨据斋意，臣切见上件亡魂，涉生以来，造业纵情，罔知检戒，厌世之后，积愆抱衅，自致沈沦，流曳三途，颠连五苦，惟思执滞，岂念超凌。 眷属姻亲，俱罹传染，家门大小，积致倾亡。 求替代以莫能，遂复连而无已，如斯陷溺，实可矜伤，自非玄造之拯提，曷俾下愚之安泰？
